qas.question: What was the age of Enlightenment centered on?

answers.text: the 18th century in which reason was advocated as the primary source and legitimacy for authority.

qas.question: What is the basic training of a humanist?
From where does the phrase humanist originate?
What were the studia humanitatis competing against?

context: The Age of Enlightenment is a time in Western philosophy and cultural life centered upon <a0_0>the 18th century in which reason was advocated as the primary source and legitimacy for authority.<a0_0/> Enlightenment gained momentum more or less simultaneously in many parts of <a1_0>Europe and America<a1_0/>. Developing during the Enlightenment era, Renaissance humanism as an intellectual movement spread across Europe. The basic training of the humanist was to <a2_0>speak well and write<a2_0/> (typically, in the form of a letter). The term umanista comes from the latter part of <a3_0>the 15th century<a3_0/>. The people were associated with the studia humanitatis, a novel curriculum that was competing with the <a4_0>quadrivium and scholastic logic.
